title: Shwezigon Pagoda
author: Unknown
pages:
Shwezigon Pagoda is a
gold leaf-gilded stupa
located in Nyaung-u,
near the renowned
city of Bagan in
Myanmar. The name
means "golden pagoda
on a dune" in Burmese,
referring to its origin
story. Legend says
that the king sends
forth a white elephant
with a
and declared that he
would build a pagoda
where the elephant
stopped. It finally
rested over a dune,
hence chosen as the
site of the pagoda. It
is said to be a
prototype of Burmese
stupas.



The pagoda has been
damaged by multiple
earthquakes, notably
in 1975, and has been
renovated several
times. The gilding of
the dome is recent,
done at the earliest
during 1983-1984.




I can't build the
pagoda out of pure
gold since minecraft
won't allow me to :|









Bagan itself is known
as "a land of
thousand pagodas",
since many pagodas
were build in the area
during the Bagan
Kingdom era. It is
estimated around
10,000 pagodas,
temples, and
monasteries were
constructed in the
city plains alone,
of which 2200 of them
survive to the
present day.
